section.title: The Largest Room
section.p: Despite the king’s satisfaction with the gold, his greed knew no limits excitement grew even more. He led the miller’s daughter to the largest room in the castle, filled from floor to ceiling with piles of straw. The task was the same as before—she must spin it all into gold by morning. Once again, the king locked the door behind her, leaving her alone with the impossible challenge.

section.title: The Girl's Desperation
section.p: As the girl looked around, she felt her last hope fading. She had nothing left to offer even if the little man did show up, and the thought of the king's punishment brought a deep sense of dread. Just as before, the little man appeared, his knowing gazebright eyes watching her closely. He understood her desperation, and this time instead of asking for her jewelry he made a much darker demandbigger request. In exchange for his help, he required a promise that she would give him her first-born child when she became queen. The girl, too scared to think of another way, agreed to the promise. She knew it was the only way to survive the night and fulfill the king’s command.

image.alt: The girl makes one final bargain with the little man.

section.title: The Final Spinning
section.p: With the promise sealed, the little man set to work. The wheel spun through the night, filling spool after spool with golden thread. The straw transformed under his hands, glittering with a cold beautyshining brightly in the dim room. By dawn, the entire room was filled with gold, and the little man had vanished just as he had each time before. The king entered, seeing the gold-filled room, and was overjoyed.
